text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with sweet corn and wild mushroom
spoon bread that's right while we were
trying to figure out a delicious new
corn and mushroom side dish we
accidentally invented like the best
cornbread dressing ever and please do
not let the hideous looks fool you this
really really tasted delicious
so let me show you how to make it I'm
pretty sure you're gonna love it so
we're gonna start by placing some dry
porcini mushrooms in a small bowl and
covering it with hot water pretty much
any dried wild mushroom will work but I
really like the porcini great flavor and
of course if you have access to fresh
porcini by all means use those so we're
gonna let that sit about 30 minutes
while we get our dry ingredients
together so into a mixing bowl I'm going
to add some all-purpose flour some
cornmeal a little bit of white sugar
some salt some baking soda not powder
don't even think about adding baking
powder some freshly ground black pepper
and of course a little bit of cayenne
all right and then we're going to take a
whisk and we're just going to mix up
those dry ingredients to make sure
everything is incorporated by the way to
the person that email me asking me why
we call these two dry ingredients mostly
it's because of the lack of wetness
that's pretty much it and then after 1/2
hour your mushrooms should be nicely
softened you're going to go ahead and
squeeze those out by the way you can
save that liquid for soup what kind
mushroom soup alright you're going to
squeeze out those mushrooms and you're
going to give them a nice fine chop I
love the flavor of dried mushrooms but
not necessarily the texture so I don't
like them in too big of pieces so that
looks good and what we're going to do
with those mushrooms is take one stick
of butter melt it over medium heat and
as soon as it melts we're going to dump
in those mushrooms and we're going to
cook those for about three minutes
and what's going to happen here is we
sizzle those mushrooms in the butter the
butter is going to start tasting like
porcini mushroom and the porcini
mushrooms are going to start tasting
like butter both of those things are
good alright so after cooking the
mushrooms in that butter for about three
minutes I just turned off the heat and
we're going to let that cool down a
little that should cool down for at
least 10 minutes all right so we're
going to set that aside we're going to
go back over to our mixing bowl for
final assembly which means you're going
to add two large eggs
I love how eggs look on top of flour
we're going to add a big splash of
butter melt
and a little splash of regular milk and
we're going to give that a mix and we're
going to add other stuff in here so it
doesn't have to be super well mixed so
just give it a few spins at that point
you're going to dump in the butter
porcini mixture and 1 pound of sweet
corn now I'm using frozen corn of course
it's been thawed and drained thoroughly
and get a nice premium brand don't buy
that generic or army surplus stuff I
want it to be actual corn not koruna
like so get something good we're gonna
switch to a large spoon EULA and we're
going to mix that together and then last
but not least because I remembered I had
them in the fridge I chopped up a few
green onions threw that in I knew that
would be good in there how could it not
be so I'm going to stir those in and
that mixture is ready for the oven
we're going to transfer that into a
buttered or oiled casserole dish
anything you can fit it in will work
we're going to give it several shaking
shakers and then numerous very
enthusiastic old habit oppas and then
that's going to go in a preheated 350
degree oven for between 30 and 35
minutes or till it's just barely set it
will be very lightly springy to the
touch the old clean knife trick will
also work although it could have a
little smudge on it even if it's done
and yes that looks absolutely dreadful
it looks like a regular casserole that
caught the Black Plague but that's okay
it tasted spectacularly and when we
grabbed our spoon because it is after
all spoon bread it actually looked much
much well not much better it looked
nominally less horrific but while it may
have looked like hell it definitely
tasted like heaven that sweet buttery
corn those earthy mushrooms and like I
said if you like cornbread stuffing or
dressing this was incredible moist the
perfect crumb just really really good
and we saved the step of making
cornbread first we did this in one
procedure and yes tasting this on that
plain plate was kind of sad so let me
add some props there we go
that's much better and because I plan on
serving this during the holidays I had
to make sure it was good with gravy and
what was the verdict yes good with gravy
so that's good news so anyway there you
go corn and wild mushroom spoon bread
like I said we were just trying to come
up with a simple baked corn
roll type side dish and it turned into
this and while admittedly very ugly
after baking it ended up being a
beautiful tasting dish and what I hope
you try so head over to food wishes comm
for all the ingredient amounts and more
info as usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
